author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Protest against delay in arresting RJD MLA accused of rape charge

The bandh called by National Democratic Alliance leaders in Nalanda on Sunday protesting against the delay in the arrest of RJD MLA Rajballabh Yadav evoked good response. People remained indoors and business establishments downed the shutters at the district headquarters Biharsharief. The NDA leaders charged that the RJD MLA had not been arrested yet as he had got “protection” from the government.

The RJD MLA from Nawada has been absconding for a month in connection with the alleged rape of a minor girl from adjacent Nalanda district.

The incident happened on the night of February 6 and the complaint against the MLA was registered with the Nalanda police on February 9.

Following the arrest warrant from the local court, the district police of Nawada and Nalanda have been conducting raids at all possible hideouts and have also attached immovable properties of the MLA.
title: Good response to NDA’s Nalanda bandh call
